intro: Maytenus wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan mayten, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. Maytenus wallichii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
